actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to increase from 22 to 24 the age until which child's insurance benefits may be paid on the basis of full-time student status, and the age before which a child must have become disabled in order to qualify for such benefits on the basis of disability.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Increases from 22 to 24 the age until which child's insurance benefits under title II of the Social Security Act (Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) may be paid on the basis of full-time student status, and the age before which a child must have become disabled in order to qualify for such benefits on the basis of disability.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to increase from 22 to 24 the age until which child's insurance benefits may be paid on the basis of full-time student status, and the age before which a child must have become disabled in order to qualify for such benefits on the basis of disability.
